issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Looks like in union case, some code path may pass directories in newFiles. Probably legacy copyData/moveData; both seem to assume that these paths are files, but do not actually enforce it.
fields.summary: insert DML event may attempt to calculate a checksum on directories

comments.body:
Doesn't make sense to make sure every input path ensures the recursion that it doesn't itself need; added recursion to the event code itself.
[~ashutoshc] [~jcamachorodriguez] can you take a look? Will create an RB shortly

ATTACHMENT ID: 12908449 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Test failures are existing unstable tests... [~ashutoshc] can you take a look?

+1 Patch fixes issue at hand.

However, traversing FS in move task will be expensive. List of new files created should be communicated back from job to avoid this traversal. That should be done in a follow-up.

[~ashutoshc] the thing is, existing code that returns directories never needs to traverse these files, and I suspect propagating it from FSOP will be a major pain. E.g. MM tables have to write a separate file for that on FS, cause there's no good channel otherwise.

So it makes sense to do it only for the events.
Committed to master. Thanks for the review!
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
